subject: Business
title: Situational Leadership Theory
description: Learn Situational Leadership Theory in one minute.

hook.text: A new hire needs step-by-step instructions. A veteran needs space. Same leader, completely different approaches.

buildup.text: Hersey and Blanchard's model says leaders should adapt their style to the follower's competence and commitment.

discovery.text: Four styles: directing (low skill), coaching (growing skill), supporting (high skill, low will), delegating (both high).

twist.text: Most leaders have a default style they apply to everyone. Effective leaders flex across all four.

climax.text: A leader who micromanages experts drives them away. One who delegates to novices sets them up to fail.

punchline.text: There's no best leadership style. There's only the right one for right now.

quiz.question: What does situational leadership theory recommend?
options: Adapting your style to each team member's competence and commitment
Using one consistent style for fairness
